content.value:
The top app bar provides content and actions related to the current screen.
Itâ€™s used for branding, screen titles, navigation, and actions.
Sets or gets the active contextual menu.
A top app bar can transform into a contextual action bar to provide contextual actions to selected items. Upon closing, the contextual action bar transforms back into a top app bar.
The name of the contextual menu. Used by the contextual property of the Appbar component.
Determines the visibility of the component when attached to an Appbar.

Avatars are circular components that usually wrap an image or icon.
They can be used to represent a person or an object.

<cxl-avatar text="GB"></cxl-avatar>
<cxl-avatar text="GB" size="small" primary></cxl-avatar>
<cxl-avatar text="GB" size="big" secondary></cxl-avatar>
A backdrop appears behind all other surfaces in an app, displaying contextual and actionable content.

Chips represent complex entities in small blocks. A chip can contain several
different elements such as avatars, text, and icons.
Buttons allow users to take actions, and make choices, with a single tap.
Cards contain content and actions about a single subject.

<cxl-card>
  <cxl-c flex pad16>
    <cxl-avatar style="background:#ccc"></cxl-avatar>
    <cxl-c style="margin-left: 24px">
      <cxl-t subtitle>Card Title</cxl-t>
      <cxl-t subtitle2>Secondary Text</cxl-t>
    </cxl-c>
  </cxl-c>
  <cxl-c pad16>
    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.
  </cxl-c>
</cxl-card>
Checkboxes allow the user to select one or more items from a set. Checkboxes can be used to turn an option on or off.
Chips are compact elements that represent an input, attribute, or action.

<cxl-chip>Single Chip</cxl-chip>
<cxl-chip secondary removable>Removable</cxl-chip>
<cxl-chip><cxl-avatar size="small"></cxl-avatar> Chip with Avatar</cxl-chip>
Dialogs inform users about a task and can contain critical information, require decisions, or involve multiple tasks.

<cxl-dialog>
<cxl-c pad16>
<cxl-t h5>Title</cxl-t>
<cxl-t>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam tincidunt luctus eleifend.</cxl-t>
</cxl-c>
</cxl-dialog>

<cxl-dialog-alert tabindex="-1" title-text="Alert Dialog" message="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.">
</cxl-dialog-alert>

<cxl-dialog-confirm tabindex="-1" title-text="Confirmation Dialog" message="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.">
</cxl-dialog-confirm>

children.sig: openModal({ modal, container }: { modal: Element, container: Element }): void
children.name: openModal

content.value:
Drawers are surfaces containing supplementary content that are anchored
to the left or right edge of the screen.

<cxl-drawer right permanent visible>
  <cxl-c pad16>
    <cxl-t h6>Right Drawer Title</cxl-t>
    <cxl-t>Right Drawer Content</cxl-t>
  </cxl-c>
</cxl-drawer>
A floating action button (FAB) represents the primary action of a screen.
Display the ratio of characters used and the total character limit.

<cxl-field>
  <cxl-label>Field Label</cxl-label>
  <cxl-input touched invalid value="Input Value"></cxl-input>
  <cxl-field-help invalid>Field Error Text</cxl-field-help>
</cxl-field>
Used to group several input components.

The Material Design responsive layout grid is an overarching guide to the placement of components and elements.
The responsive layout grid adapts to screen sizes and orientation, ensuring consistency across layouts.

<cxl-grid coltemplate="auto auto auto" style="color:#fff">
  <cxl-c xs1 style="background:#a00; padding: 2px">1</cxl-c>
  <cxl-c xs1 style="background:#0a0; padding:2px">2</cxl-c>
  <cxl-c xs1 style="background:#0a0; padding:2px">3</cxl-c>
  <cxl-c xs2 style="background:#00a; padding:2px">4</cxl-c>
  <cxl-c xs1 style="background:#00a; padding:2px">5</cxl-c>
</cxl-grid>
Input fields let users enter and edit text.
Used by element that do not directly receive focus. ie Input, Textarea
Lists are continuous, vertical indexes of text or images.

<cxl-list>
  <cxl-item><cxl-avatar></cxl-avatar> One Line Item</cxl-item>
  <cxl-item><cxl-avatar></cxl-avatar> One Line Item</cxl-item>
  <cxl-item><cxl-avatar></cxl-avatar> One Line Item</cxl-item>
</cxl-list>
A form input component that allows the user to select multiple option from a dropdown list

<cxl-field>
  <cxl-label>Multi Select Box with label</cxl-label>
  <cxl-multiselect placeholder="(Select an Option)">
    <cxl-option selected value="1">Option 1</cxl-option>
    <cxl-option selected value="2">Option 2</cxl-option>
    <cxl-option value="3">Option 3</cxl-option>
  </cxl-multiselect>
</cxl-field>
Placeholder value if nothing is selected.
Navigation drawers provide access to destinations in your app.
Linear progress indicators display progress by animating an indicator along the length of a fixed, visible track.

Radio buttons allow the user to select one option from a set.
Use radio buttons when the user needs to see all available options.

<cxl-radio inline name="test" value="1">Radio 1</cxl-radio>
<cxl-radio inline name="test" value="2" checked>Radio 2</cxl-radio>
A form input component that allows the user to select a single option from a list
Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values.
Snackbars provide brief messages about app processes at the bottom of the screen.
Spinners are used to indicate that the app is performing an action that the user needs to wait on.
Icon name or href to an svg sprite. The sprite must exist in the document.
Switches toggle the state of a single item on or off.
Assign a name to the tab. If set the tab will be focusable.
Tables display sets of data across rows and columns.
Tabs organize content across different screens, data sets, and other interactions.
Text fields let users enter and edit text that spans in multiple lines.

<cxl-field>
  <cxl-label>Prefilled Text Area</cxl-label>
  <cxl-textarea value="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut"></cxl-textarea>
</cxl-field>
Show or hide an element when clicked.
